<think>
Alright, I'm trying to figure out where and when this play is set. The title is "Zelonide, princesse de Sparte" by Charles-Claude Genest, published in 1682. Looking at the context, it mentions people like Pyrrhus and places like Sparta.

First, Sparta immediately makes me think of ancient Greece because that's a well-known city-state there. So, the location is likely Sparta in Greece. I'm pretty sure Sparta was a significant place during the ancient Greek period, so that fits.

Now for the time period. The play mentions Pyrrhus, who I remember was an ancient Greek king. Specifically, he was the king of Epirus and had conflicts with Sparta. From what I recall, his active years were around the 3rd century BCE. So, if the play is about Sparta and involves Pyrrhus, it's probably set in that era.

The timeframe for ancient Greece varies, but since Pyrrhus was around 300-270 BCE, I'll estimate the start as -300 (300 BCE) and end as -270 (270 BCE). That seems reasonable because it's when Sparta would have been involved in conflicts with Epirus under his rule.

I don't see any indication that the play is set elsewhere, so the location should be Sparta in Greece. I'm not entirely sure if there's a specific Wikidata QID for Sparta as a historical entity, but I think it might be Q206748 or similar, though I'll note it as "None" if uncertain.

Overall, combining the mention of Sparta and Pyrrhus points to an ancient Greek setting around the 3rd century BCE.
</think>
